greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number x such that gcd(phi(x), sigma(x)) = n.
comment: Values are frequently identical to terms of A077102. Since gcd(a,b) and gcd(a+b,a-b) may differ, so may the smallest solutions. A077102(m) and a(m) differ at m = 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 28, 32, 40, etc.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..120
formula: a(n) = Min{x: A023897(x)= n}, smallest balanced number (A020492) for which the quotient equals n.
mathematica: f[x_] := Apply[GCD, {DivisorSigma[1, x], EulerPhi[x]}] t=Table[0, {100}]; Do[s=f[n]; If[s<101&&t[[s]]==0, t[[s]]=n], {n, 1, 10^13}];
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(x=n);while(gcd(eulerphi(x),sigma(x))!=n, x++); x \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 09 2013
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 12 2002
